text: Jacques Santer (born 18 May 1937 in Wasserbillig)Thewes, Guy. "Les gouvernements du Grand-Duch√© depuis 1848." Service information et presse. Luxembourg: Imprimerie Centrale, 2011. is a Luxembourgian politician. He was finance minister of Luxembourg from 1979 until 1989. He was the 22nd Prime Minister of Luxembourg serving from 1984 to 1995. He was a member of the Christian Social People's Party, which has been the leading party in the Luxembourg government since 1979. As Prime Minister of Luxembourg he also led the negotiations on the Single European Act, which effectively set aside the 20-year-old Luxembourg Compromise. He was the President of the European Commission from 1995 to 1999. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1937 births Category:Living people Category:European Commissioners Category:Government ministers of Luxembourg Category:Prime ministers of Luxembourg
title: Jacques Santer
